info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 7:57PM EDT until July 02 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion oF Mecklenburg County. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas along the I-77 and I-485 corridors around Huntersville and north Charlotte where as much as 2 inches of rain could accumulate this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 755 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntersville, Northeast Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, Cornelius, Davidson, Harrisburg, Ramsey Creek Park, Lake Norman and Croft. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
